snippet: With a particularly brutal attack on a young student rallying people across Turkey, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan denounced violence against women on Monday as the country’s “bleeding wound.”
abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan, responding to public outcry over Feb 11 attempted rape and brutal murder of student Ozgecan Aslan, denounces violence against women and vows perpetrators of such acts will receive maximum penalties; human rights group Bianet reports 31% jump in number of women murdered in Turkey over last year with 281 women murdered in 2014.
lead_paragraph: With a particularly brutal attack on a young student rallying people across Turkey, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan denounced violence against women on Monday as the country’s “bleeding wound.”

headline.main: Turkey: President Condemns Violence Against Women After Student’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Turkey: President Condemns Violence Against Women After Student’s Killing
